intro: Neonauclea morotaiensis, commonly known as Morotai ironwood, is a species of flowering plant native to the island of Morotai in Indonesia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, hard wood and evergreen foliage. The plant typically grows as a small tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its flowers are small and white, often clustered in inflorescences, and it produces small, round fruits that contain seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Neonauclea morotaiensis is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
